Package me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.container

Class StorageContainer

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.container.StorageContainer
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArrayContainer, PDContainer
public abstract class StorageContainer extends Object
Abstraction class for StorageAPI. Provides tons of generic methods/code that should be able to be applied globally to any storage implementation. This class will automatically use the cache, and limit the flush of the extending containers, as well as provide store, delete, and retrieve methods.

  • Method Details

    • storeHook

      protected abstract StoreHook storeHook()
      Required implementation method, specifies how this StorageContainer's store operations are performed.
      Returns:
      The StoreHook behavior.

    • deleteHook

      protected abstract DeleteHook deleteHook()
      Required implementation method, specifies how this StorageContainer's delete operations are performed.
      Returns:
      The DeleteHook behavior.

    • retrieveHook

      protected abstract RetrieveHook retrieveHook()
      Required implementation method, specifies how this StorageContainer's retrieve operations are performed.
      Returns:
      The RetrieveHook behavior.

    • completeHook

      protected abstract CompleteHook completeHook()
      Required implementation method, specifies how store and delete operations are completed. i.e, how to save the File after they've been modified.
      Returns:
      The CompleteHook behavior.

    • getKeys

      public abstract Set<String> getKeys(String path)
      Returns a list of all sub-paths one level below the provided path. This should return an empty list if the path has no sub-paths.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to get the keys for.
      Returns:
      The List of keys that are under the provided path.

    • get

      public <T> T get(String path) throws ClassCastException
      Returns a cached object. Objects are only cached after they've initially been retrieved. Therefore, this method will always return null if you haven't retrieved a path yet.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type to cast to
      Parameters:
      path - The path to get the data from.
      Returns:
      The cached object, or null if none exists at the path.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - If the cached object is not of type T
      See Also:
      • retrieve(String)
      • getOrElse(String, Object)

    • getOrElse

      public <T> T getOrElse(String path, T orElse)
      Returns a cached object, or an alternative value if it doesn't exist. Objects are only cached after they've initially been retrieved.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type to cast to
      Parameters:
      path - The path to get the data from.
      orElse - The object to return if the path does not exist or returns null.
      Returns:
      The cached object, or null if none exists at the path.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - If the cached object is not of type T
      See Also:
      • get(String)
      • retrieveOrElse(String, Object)

    • set

      public void set(String path, Object data)
      Sets data into a cache that will eventually be updated into the data structure. Data that is set may be lost in the case of a hard crash. To determine how often this data is pushed to the structure, you will need to set your StorageSettings with a flush rate.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the data.
      data - The data to set.
      See Also:
      • for storing data within the source.

    • setAll

      public void setAll(Map<String,Object> data)
      Sets data into a cache that will eventually be updated into the data structure. Data that is set may be lost in the case of a hard crash. To determine how often this data is pushed to the structure, you will need to set your StorageSettings with a flush rate.
      Parameters:
      data - A map with all the paths and objects to set.
      See Also:
      • for storing data within the source.

    • remove

      public void remove(String path)
      Puts a path into a cache that will eventually be updated into the data structure to remove them. Data that is removed may be lost in the case of a hard crash. To determine how often this data is pushed to the structure, you will need to set your StorageSettings with a flush rate.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the data to remove.
      See Also:
      • for immediately deleting data within the source.

    • removeAll

      public void removeAll(List<String> paths)
      Puts paths into a cache that will eventually be updated into the data structure to remove them. Data that is removed may be lost in the case of a hard crash. To determine how often this data is pushed to the structure, you will need to set your StorageSettings with a flush rate.
      Parameters:
      paths - The path of the data to remove.
      See Also:
      • for immediately deleting data within the source.

    • store

      public CompletableFuture<Void> store(String path, Object data)
      Stores data to the data structure. This method is executed asynchronously. It is more efficient and better to use set(String, Object) and then call flush() if you need to save many things immediately.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to store the data to.
      data - The data to store in the file format.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that will be completed once the async storage has been finalized, but before StorageHook.complete() is called.
      See Also:
      • for caching objects instead of writing directly to the structure.

    • storeAll

      public CompletableFuture<Void> storeAll(Map<String,Object> data)
      Stores data to the data structure. This method is executed asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      data - A map with all the paths and objects to store.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that will be completed once all data has been stored. This will complete before StorageHook.complete() has been called.
      See Also:
      • for caching objects instead of writing directly to the structure.

    • delete

      public CompletableFuture<Void> delete(String path)
      Removes a path from the data source. This method is executed asynchronously. It is more efficient and better to use remove(String) and then call flush() if you need to delete many things immediately.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to remove.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that will be completed once the async deletion has been finished. This will complete before StorageHook.complete() has been called.
      See Also:
      • for removing data using a cache. (Recommended)

    • deleteAll

      public CompletableFuture<Void> deleteAll(List<String> paths)
      Removes multiple paths from the data source. This method is executed asynchronously. Useful if you're removing lots of items and don't want to call StorageHook.complete() constantly.
      Parameters:
      paths - The paths to remove.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that will be completed once the async deletion has been finished.
      See Also:
      • for removing data using a cache. (Recommended)

    • retrieve

      public <T> T retrieve(String path)
      Retrieves an object directly from the data source with implicit casting. Note: This method will not recompose StorageDecomposers. Note: This method is blocking, and will block until the data structure returns an object. It is highly recommended to only use this method if you know your data structure will not block
      Type Parameters:
      T - The implicit type that will be cast to.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The cast object from the path, or null if it doesn't exist.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving with explicit casting, or to recompose decomposed objects.
      • for retrieving data asynchronously.

    • retrieve

      public <T> T retrieve(Class<T> type, String path)
      Retrieves the object directly from the data source with explicit casting. If you want to retrieve a StorageDecomposer, you will need to use this method and provide the type. Note: This method is blocking, and will block for up to 5 seconds. It is highly recommended to only use this method if you know your data structure will not block
      Type Parameters:
      T - The explicit type that will be cast to.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of Object to get. If this Object has a StorageDecomposer, it will be used.
      path - The path to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The cast object from the path, or null if it doesn't exist.
      See Also:
      • to get the value with implicit casting.
      • for retrieving data asynchronously.

    • retrieveAsync

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> retrieveAsync(String path)
      Retrieves an object directly from the data source with implicit casting. This method is executed asynchronously, and the future will be completed when the data has been returned. Note: This method will not recompose StorageDecomposers.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The implicit type that will be cast to.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The cast object from the path, or null if it doesn't exist.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving with explicit casting, or to recompose decomposed objects.

    • retrieveAsync

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> retrieveAsync(Class<T> type, String path)
      Retrieves the object directly from the data source with explicit casting. If you want to retrieve a StorageDecomposer, you will need to use this method and provide the type. This method is executed asynchronously, and the future will be completed when the data has been returned.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The explicit type that will be cast to.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of Object to get. If this Object has a StorageDecomposer, it will be used.
      path - The path to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The cast object from the path, or null if it doesn't exist.
      See Also:
      • to get the value with implicit casting.

    • retrieveOrElse

      public <T> T retrieveOrElse(String path, T orElse)
      Retrieves an object directly from the data source with implicit casting. Note: This method will not recompose StorageDecomposers. Note: This method is blocking, and will block until the data structure returns an object. It is highly recommended to only use this method if you know your data structure will not block If the data structure returns null, the provided object will be returned instead.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The implicit type that will be cast to.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to retrieve.
      orElse - The object to return if the path does not exist or returns null.
      Returns:
      The cast object from the path, or null if it doesn't exist.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving with explicit casting, or to recompose decomposed objects.
      • for retrieving data asynchronously.

    • retrieveOrElse

      public <T> T retrieveOrElse(Class<T> type, String path, T orElse)
      Retrieves the object directly from the data source with explicit casting. If you want to retrieve a StorageDecomposer, you will need to use this method and provide the type. Note: This method is blocking, and will block for up to 5 seconds. It is highly recommended to only use this method if you know your data structure will not block If the data structure returns null, the provided object will be returned instead.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The explicit type that will be cast to.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of Object to get. If this Object has a StorageDecomposer, it will be used.
      path - The path to retrieve.
      orElse - The object to return if the path does not exist or returns null.
      Returns:
      The cast object from the path, or null if it doesn't exist.
      See Also:
      • to get the value with implicit casting.
      • for retrieving data asynchronously.

    • retrieveOrElseAsync

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> retrieveOrElseAsync(String path, T orElse)
      Retrieves an object directly from the data source with implicit casting. This method is executed asynchronously, and the future will be completed when the data has been returned. Note: This method will not recompose StorageDecomposers. If the data structure returns null, the provided object will be returned instead.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The implicit type that will be cast to.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to retrieve.
      orElse - The object to return if the path does not exist or returns null.
      Returns:
      The cast object from the path, or null if it doesn't exist.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving with explicit casting, or to recompose decomposed objects.

    • retrieveOrElseAsync

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> retrieveOrElseAsync(Class<T> type, String path, T orElse)
      Retrieves the object directly from the data source with explicit casting. If you want to retrieve a StorageDecomposer, you will need to use this method and provide the type. This method is executed asynchronously, and the future will be completed when the data has been returned. If the data structure returns null, the provided object will be returned instead.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The explicit type that will be cast to.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of Object to get. If this Object has a StorageDecomposer, it will be used.
      path - The path to retrieve.
      orElse - The object to return if the path does not exist or returns null.
      Returns:
      The cast object from the path, or null if it doesn't exist.
      See Also:
      • to get the value with implicit casting.

    • cache

      public void cache(String path, Object object)
      Caches a retrieved object to the cache.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to cache to
      object - The object to cache

    • cacheRetrieve

      public void cacheRetrieve(String path, Object object)
      Attempts to cache an object, but obeys the StorageSettings.isCachedOnRetrieve() setting.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to cache to
      object - The object to cache

    • isCached

      public boolean isCached(String path)
      Returns if the provided path is cached.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to check.
      Returns:
      If the path is cached.

    • getSettings

      public StorageSettings getSettings()
      Returns the StorageSettings for this Container.
      Returns:
      The StorageSettings

    • getCache

      public StorageCache getCache()
      Returns the StorageCache that is cached objects.
      Returns:
      The StorageCache

    • getAPI

      public IStorageAPI getAPI()
      Returns the IStorageAPI that was used to create this container.
      Returns:
      The IStorageAPI

    • flush

      public CompletableFuture<Void> flush()
      Updates the StorageContainer with the set and remove caches. After flushing, these maps will be cleared. Flushing will not empty the cached data, only the data that needs to be updated to the structure.
      Returns:
      A future that is completed once the flush has finished.
      See Also:
      • for adding objects into the Set cache.
      • for adding paths into the Remove cache.

    • clearCache

      public void clearCache()
      Clears the cache

    • isSupported

      public boolean isSupported(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns if a class is supported for storage in this container. All primitives and Strings are automatically supported. Other classes will need to have a StorageDecomposer to be considered supported.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The type to check.
      Returns:
      If the specified class is able to be stored.
